Saturday, March 31, 2018

Why no pictures of hugging pakodawallahs? Link: https://indiadying.blogspot.com/2018/03/why-no-pictures-of-hugging-pakodawallahs.html

There is a severe shortage of jobs in India, wrote C Bhagat. "Many educated youngsters continue to live with their parents," he wrote. "Whatever the government might think they are not happy just to be 'pakodawallahs Link: https://blogs.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/The-underage-optimist/more-jobs-please-indian-youth-dont-want-to-be-just-pakodawallas/ '." A 'pakoda' is deep fried vegetables coated in spicy batter Link: https://en.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/pakora . Pakodas became news when the Prime Minister, responding to rising unemployment, said that earning Rs 200 per day selling pakodas Link: http://www.freepressjournal.in/india/amidst-rising-unemployment-pm-narendra-modi-gives-india-pakoda-for-thought/1218303 is also employment. It is not just unemployment, a much bigger problem is under-employment, in that people resort to anything to earn just enough to survive Link: https://thewire.in/business/no-prime-minister-earning-rs-200-a-day-selling-pakodas-employment , wrote G Sappal. Government programs have failed to create large scale meaningful employment. Employment levels actually fell between 2014 and 2016. "Employment in the total Indian economy shrank Link: https://www.livemint.com/Politics/sYBQOalLczD2rlAqE0xoWL/Forget-job-growth-employment-in-India-fell-between-2014-and.html by 0.1% in financial year 2015-16 and by 0.2% in 2014-15," wrote M Chakravarty. These were years of high growth, with the GDP "growing by 7.4% in 2014-15 and 8.2% in 2015-16". Gopalan and Singhi used Labour Bureau data to conclude that the theory of 'jobless growth' is a myth Link: https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/vq9GUtDmIQfoQnKHOSvnGK/Indias-jobless-growth-is-a-myth.html . They found that 75 million jobs were created between 2009-10 and 2015-16, much more than the total of 61 million job seekers. 84% of workers earned less that Rs 10,000 per month, just over Rs 300 per day, and 40% of workers found work only for a part of the year. This view is countered by M Vyas who wrote that the same Labour Bureau figures showthat job creation was good till 2011-12 Link: https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/oIfsn1Djr4KpR1mNNe1zDN/Indias-jobless-growth-is-not-a-myth.html but fell off sharply after that, so it should not be generalized. From now on workers maybe hired for fixed terms in all industries Link: https://www.hindustantimes.com/business-news/govt-extends-provision-for-fixed-term-employment-to-all-sectors/story-D8PhSRUBunP2c2C65WIYIM.html , the government said recently. From now "no notice of termination of employment shall be necessary in the case of temporary and badli workmen" said the amendment. 'Badli' means 'replacement'. India's labor laws are so stringent Link: https://in.reuters.com/article/uk-india-labour-reforms/factbox-indias-stringent-labour-laws-idINKBN0F504S20140630 that companies are reluctant to expand in size so as to avoid employing more regular workers. Apparently there are 44 federal labor laws Link: https://www.livemint.com/Industry/PwXRPzUsl8RWNSwRsnaRrI/How-Indian-labour-laws-strangle-growth.html , some dating back to 1923, and 150 state laws in India. "Revamping labour laws and encouraging urbanization could create as many as 110 million jobs over the next 10 years," said Goldman Sachs. Unions condemned the government's move as an attempt to "make employment absolutely fragile just in the name of ease of doing business". Actually the shift to contract labour has been growing for 17 years Link: https://www.livemint.com/Money/in820rBafIqhkbesEyBJoI/The-growth-rate-of-contract-workers-has-been-far-higher-than.html , wrote M Chakravarty. From 1997-98 to 2014-15 the Compound Annual Growth Rate, or CAGR, of directly employed workers was 0.55% while the CAGR of contract workers was 6.79% over the same period. Contract workers increased from 16.41% to 35.35% in organized manufacturing. More than 90% of workers are in the informal sector Link: https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/wbGabfgoBnHwJPWHBZbPLI/Is-informal-the-new-normal.html without any job security anyway. While advising people to sell pakodas the Prime Minister is on a hugging spree. Better than fiddling?

Even if no deficit why allow theft of $600 billion a year? Link: https://indiadying.blogspot.com/2018/03/even-if-no-deficit-why-allow-theft-of.html

In 2013, India was counted among the "Fragile Five", along with Brazil, Indonesia, South Africa and Turkey, wrote W Pesek. "Even before Donald Trump came along, India and Indonesia had been moving toward favoured-investment status Link: https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/42l23SoT9MEYBkKVOxtgQI/Donald-Trump-is-making-emerging-markets-safe-havens.html among Wall Street set," Trump may have started a trade war. "That puts sizeable and rapidly growing, but integrated economies at a unique advantage. In Asia, that primarily means India, Indonesia and the Philippines." Japan and South Korea have their own problems with Trump and Taiwan's existence is threatened by China. So these 3 countries with "vibrant and growing consumer sectors" are the best bet. Why India is considered a safe investment destination is difficult to understand because the economy is growing without producing jobs, as shown by 28 million applications for 90,000 mainly manual jobs Link: https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/over-2-8-crore-apply-for-90000-railways-jobs/articleshow/63551672.cms in Indian Railways. Growing consumption without increase in production results in a current account deficit Link: https://tradingeconomics.com/india/current-account-to-gdp every year. Despite slogans about Make in India Link: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Make_in_India , we have been running adeficit every quarter ever since this government Link: https://tradingeconomics.com/india/current-account came to power. Current Account Deficit means an outflow of wealth to other countries Link: https://www.investopedia.com/terms/c/currentaccountdeficit.asp and results in a weakening of currency. "The trade war is a symptom of the waning clout of the US Link: https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/TvmRWJi1UldM1HhAuFzBdJ/The-trade-war-is-a-symptom-of-the-waning-clout-of-the-US.html ," wrote M Chakravarty. As a country becomes wealthy other countries start to compete so that the dominant economy shifts to financial services. Financialization leads to loss of its dominant position. This apparently happened to Britain, as it lost its place in manufacturing to the US, and to the Netherlands earlier. Britain's wealth was dependent on wholesale plunder of resources from colonies Link: https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2009/jun/08/british-empire-colonies-banks-reform , conquered by military brutality. The US has its own resources, exporting oil to India Link: https://www.thehindubusinessline.com/companies/indian-oil-buys-first-shale-oil-from-us/article9816291.ece for the first time last year. China is now a bigger economy in terms of Purchasing Power Parity. If Britain's wealth was by robbery China's wealth is by theft. China forces foreign companies to transfer their intellectual property andencourages an enormous industry of fakes Link: https://herald.dawn.com/news/1153413 . How much has it stolen? From $225 billion to $600 billion annually for years Link: http://money.cnn.com/2018/03/23/technology/china-us-trump-tariffs-ip-theft/index.html . When Britain lost its pre-eminent position John MaynardKeynes, once an "ardent advocate of free trade", reversed his position Link: https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/j7IVCMNA4xbQJqGLu2T4BI/Look-to-history-to-understand-the-US-tariffs.html and supported protectionism. After calculating balance of trade in goods and servicesProf R Hausmann came to a net debt of $9.1 trillion Link: https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/WpPKNtFTgqnIE6ZPIekL0H/The-dark-matter-of-global-trade.html for the US. At 4% the US should be paying $364 billion a year in interest. But it pays nothing. Because the invisible earnings of companies like, Apple, Google and Facebook, wipe out all the deficit. So the US is not weakening after all. Crafty.

Bailing out before bailing in becomes law. Link: https://indiadying.blogspot.com/2018/03/bailing-out-before-bailing-in-becomes.html

"People have made a run on banks, withdrawing money from ATMs and banks fearing the banks could collapse Link: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/politics-and-nation/what-is-a-bank-run-its-in-full-swing-in-telangana-and-andhra-pradesh/articleshow/63531528.cms due to scams that have come to light recently and a provision in the Financial Resolution and Deposit Insurance (FRDI) Bill 2017. Even though there is no risk to banks due to either of these factors, a prolonged bank run can affect banks adversely," was a news report. ATM machines have been shut down because of lack of cash and banks are allowing withdrawal of up to Rs 20,000-40,000 per person per day. This probably reinforces fears that banks are trying to prevent withdrawals because they are bankrupt. People are queuing up to withdraw money prematurely from fixed deposits. The Finance Minister hasassured people that their deposits are protected Link: https://www.firstpost.com/business/frdi-bill-govt-will-fully-protect-public-deposits-says-finance-minister-arun-jaitley-4255187.html but people do not believe him. The FRDI Bill 2017 is meant to address bankruptcies in financial services providers Link: http://www.financialexpress.com/economy/what-is-frdi-bill-all-you-need-to-know-about-financial-resolution-and-deposit-insurance-bill-2017-in-just-10-points/964461/ , like banks. The bill contains a 'bail in' clause, which means that the failing company Link: https://www.investopedia.com/terms/b/bailin.asp has to use its own assets, including depositors money, to pay its debts. This is opposed to a 'bail out' clause which means rescue by a third party, usually the government. Most other countries have a bail in provision to prevent use of taxpayer money Link: https://www.firstpost.com/business/frdi-bill-an-analysis-of-global-experience-explains-why-depositors-in-india-should-be-indeed-worried-4256375.html to save banks, especially after the financial crisis of 2008, when governments bailed out banks considered too big to fail. In fact, India has had a similar provision since 1993 which protects a total of Rs 100,000 of deposits a person has in any particular bank. However, previously the government has protected depositors even of failing private banks. Thus, in 2003 the Punjab National Bank, a public sector bank, took over Nedungadi Bank Link: http://www.financialexpress.com/archive/pnb-completes-merger-with-nedungadi-bank/69894/ and in 2004, another public sector bank, the Oriental Bank of Commerce, took over the failing Global Trust Bank Link: http://www.frontline.in/static/html/fl2117/stories/20040827003502800.htm . Since the government is the majority owner of public sector banks it protected depositors from losing their money. Why are people taking their money out of public sector banks despite reassurances from the Finance Minister. Probably because people have lost their trust in this government after the sudden demonetization of of high value notes Link: https://qz.com/1156278/frdi-bill-india-shouldnt-use-the-ordinary-depositors-money-to-rescue-banks/ in 2016. Yet a survey in 2017found that 85% of Indians trust the government Link: https://factly.in/fact-check-pew-research-said-85-indians-trust-government/ . This makes the present run on banks in Andhra Pradesh and Telengana inexplicable. In the absence of a social safety net Indians tend to save a high proportion of their income, though it has fallen from a high of 36.82% of GDP Link: https://www.ceicdata.com/en/indicator/india/gross-savings-rate in 2008 to 29.98% in 2017. If people withdraw their money they will invest it in gold, real estate or keep it in cash. Banks will have less money to lend and the current account deficit, which is the difference between savings and investment Link: https://www.economicshelp.org/blog/6411/economics/current-account-savings-investment/ , will go up. Trust is like Humpty Dumpty. You cannot put it together once it breaks.

Can a 5 foot wall stop a cyber attack? Link: https://indiadying.blogspot.com/2018/03/can-5-foot-wall-stop-cyber-attack.html

Prime Minister Narendra Modi's app sends user information Link: https://scroll.in/article/873171/narendra-modi-app-shares-private-data-of-users-with-american-firm-without-consent-says-cyber-expert , including email address, photos, gender and name, to a US company called Clever Tap, without consent of the user, tweeted a French cyber security expert, Elliot Alderson. Clever Tap is classified as a phishing site by G-data, a software firm specialising in cyber security, based in Germany. Clever Tap, set up by three Indians, said that the data was used for analysis only Link: https://www.firstpost.com/india/narendra-modi-app-controversy-us-based-analytics-firm-clevertap-says-it-doesnt-sell-rent-or-re-market-data-4407907.html and never shared with anyone else. The BJP, Modi's party, denied that the website Link: https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/modis-website-not-on-us-server/articleshow/63495666.cms was hosted in the US. After it had been exposed the app quietly changed its privacy policy Link: http://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-india-43538178 . Elliot Alderson is a pseudonym for this expert who also claims to have hacked into Aadhaar Link: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/politics-and-nation/elliot-alderson-may-be-a-french-network-and-telecommunications-engineer/articleshow/63474646.cms , an identity number, based on photograph, prints of all 10 fingers and iris scans, which has been forced on all Indians by the government. UIDAI, which stands for Unique Identification Authority of India, called his claims "irresponsible". US internet companies were demanding Aadhaar information Link: https://www.thequint.com/news/business/aadhar-data-with-private-companies before providing services. "...American biometric technology provider L-1 Identity Solutions, open-source document database MongodB, and consulting firms Accenture and Ernst and Young - are holding all our data," said independent legal researcher U Ramanathan. The Attorney General, the top government lawyer, assured the Supreme Court that Aadhaar data is safe behind walls Link: https://www.ndtv.com/india-news/aadhaar-data-safe-behind-5-inch-thick-15-feet-high-walls-centre-to-supreme-court-1826931 that are 13 feet high and 5 feet thick. It would be comical if it wasn't so dangerous for the nation. A Right to Information activist has shown that foreign firms already have access to full Aadhaar data Link: https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/rti-activist-says-aadhaar-contract-gave-foreign-firms-access-to-unencrypted-data/articleshow/60284162.cms and are allowed to maintain it for 7 years. "....an administrator login ID and password to gain access to the UID portal can be acquired for as little a Rs 500 Link: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/politics-and-nation/indias-aadhaar-open-for-abuse-edward-snowden/articleshow/62379098.cms ," revealed an article in the Tribune. Edward Snowden, a US whistleblower, warned against misuse of Aadhaar information. A study by a think tank affiliated to the Reserve Bank of India suggested that Aadhaar is open to abuse Link: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/economy/policy/aadhaar-sitting-duck-for-cyber-criminals-says-rbi-backed-research/articleshow/62426729.cms . "A primary challenge is to protect the data from prying and excessive profit seeking excess of the business world. It is well known that businesses are increasingly operating in a highly competitive world in which ethical boundaries are rapidly being pulled down," it said. "Thanks to Aadhaar, for the first time in history of India, there is now a readily available single target for cyber criminals as well as India's external enemies." While compromising security and privacy of the whole nation the government has demanded details of breach of data Link: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/tech/internet/government-issues-notice-to-facebook-seeking-details-on-data-breach/articleshow/63518926.cms from Facebook to Cambridge Analytica. People can supply false information to Facebook Link: https://www.cnet.com/how-to/enhance-privacy-by-being-deliberately-inaccurate/ , and many do to protect their privacy, but you cannot fake your fingerprints and iris scans. Sneaked in through the Money Bill without any debate Aadhaar is the means to a most perfect police state Link: http://www.thehindu.com/opinion/lead/aadhaar-enabling-a-form-of-supersurveillance/article22444686.ece . Facebook and Donald Trump can do nothing to us but our government can. That is the fear.

Can Trump and Kim pull it off? Link: https://indiadying.blogspot.com/2018/03/can-trump-and-kim-pull-it-off.html

Pictures of an armored train from North Korea, which has been used by Kim Jong-il Link: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kim_Jong-il , father of the present President Kim Jong Un, pulling into Beijing station, were on news channels for the last few days. Police motorcade with no flags led to speculation that Kim Jong Un was visiting China Link: https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/asia_pacific/why-is-there-an-armored-train-in-beijing-is-it-kim-jong-uns/2018/03/27/2e8346dc-3192-11e8-9759-56e51591e250_story.html?utm_term=.7817431906bc for his first foreign visit since he became leader of North Korea in 2011. China confirmed his visit only after Link: http://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-43564529 his train had left Chinese territory and was back within North Korea. Why this sudden visit? It all started earlier this year when North Korea was invited to attend the Winter Olympics Link: https://edition.cnn.com/2018/03/08/politics/donald-trump-kim-jong-un/index.html in Pyeongchang by the South Korean President Moon Jae-in. This was followed by a South Korean delegation to Pyongyang which met Kim and arranged a meeting with US President Donald Trump sometime in May. Naturally Kim could not meet with Trump without consulting Beijing which is its only ally Link: https://edition.cnn.com/2018/03/27/asia/why-kim-jong-un-would-make-secret-trip-to-china-intl/index.html and economic lifeline. Donald Trump has been very aggressive against North Korea and imposed tough sanctions Link: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-northkorea-missiles-trump/u-s-imposes-more-north-korea-sanctions-trump-warns-of-phase-two-idUSKCN1G71RD which must be beginning to bite. It is in Kim's interest to make friends with the US, but the meeting is fraught with danger Link: https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/4HEbwINSaHqmYquBSd2WRN/What-can-be-expected-from-a-TrumpKim-meeting.html , wrote Prof WPS Sidhu. If the meeting fails it could result in a dangerous escalation, with North Korea resuming its nuclear tests and a possibility of US military action. "They know the meeting is very important but also very risky, there are a lot of uncertainties," said Tong Zhao, an expert on North Korea. "If the meeting fails the US could declare that diplomacy has failed and shift to a more coercive approach or even a military strike. A stable and positive relationship with China would prevent the US from launching a military strike." After Kim's visit China said that he has promised denuclearization Link: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-northkorea-missiles-china/china-says-north-korea-pledges-denuclearization-during-friendly-visit-idUSKBN1H305W . When China says denuclearization it means that the Korean peninsula should become a nuclear free zone, which means a withdrawal of US arms. That would give China complete control of the Sea of Japan because South Korea, Japan and Taiwan do not possess nuclear weapons, but China does. What if Kim Jong Un islooking for a way to unite with South Korea Link: https://blogs.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/toi-edit-page/switching-sides-kim-could-be-exploring-the-possibility-of-becoming-an-american-south-korean-ally/ with guarantees for his family and regime? asked Prof K Bajpai. In that case he would be afraid of an attack by China because China would not want US forces sitting right across its border. It is not as fanciful as it sounds. No one ever thought thatWest Germany would reunite with the East Link: https://www.britannica.com/place/Germany/The-reunification-of-Germany , until it happened, andmembers of the former Comecon Link: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_the_Comecon would go on to becomemembers of NATO Link: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Member_states_of_NATO . Can Kim Jong Un pull it off in secret during his meeting with Trump? We hope so. Will China attack if that happens? May they live in interesting times.

Monday, March 26, 2018

You can fool all of the people, but not the bond market. Link: https://indiadying.blogspot.com/2018/03/you-can-fool-all-of-people-but-not-bond.html

The government is to borrow less in the first half Link: http://www.dnaindia.com/business/report-govt-to-borrow-rs-288-lakh-crore-in-april-sept-issue-inflation-indexed-bonds-2598047 of the next financial year in response to falling prices of its bonds. Fall in prices means the government has to pay higher interest to get dealers to buy its bonds, which means higher yields. The government is to offer more short term bonds and floating rate bonds, or FRBs, where interest is set every six months and hence have lower risks. The government will raise Rs 2.88 trillion, or 48% of borrowing, in the first six months and will reduce its total borrowing by Rs 500 billion. Normally it borrows 60% in the first half of the financial year and was planning to borrow a total of Rs 6.05 trillion. Bond yields fell by 25 basis points Link: https://www.livemint.com/Money/GH2YB4OJyfc1pk81JI9uTI/Bond-yield-falls-25-bps-on-lower-borrowing-rupee-gains-for.html and the rupee strengthened against the dollar on the news. Problem is that banks are refusing to help the government by buying its bonds. Banks are required to hold a portion of their total deposits Link: https://www.moneycontrol.com/news/business/personal-finance/what-is-crr-slrrepo-rate-1260507.html in government securities, known as the Statutory Liquidity Ratio, or SLR. The present rate for SLR fixed by the Reserve Bank is 19.5% butmost banks are holding in excess of 30% Link: https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/IPG8UisjgQ8OiAdKKWOCWK/How-to-bring-back-banks-on-Bond-Street.html , wrote T Bandopadhyay. That is because banks are unwilling to lend to industry until their bad loan problems are solved so they have invested in government securities which are totally safe and provide them with some interest income. However, banks are required to value their holdings at market price, known as mark to market, and not the buying price so when the prices of bonds fall they have to show that as a loss, which adds to their non-performing assets bill. Besides, the quantity of bonds has risen because state governments have increased their borrowing from Rs 2.59 trillion in 2016 to Rs 3.43 trillion in 2017 to Rs 3.58 trillion in 2018. Which means that the banks are unable to absorb an increase in central government borrowing. So a decrease in total government borrowing and a slower pace is good news. The Reserve Bank may increase the limit for foreign investors Link: https://www.fpi.nsdl.co.in/Reports/ReportDetail.aspx?RepID=1 , to bring new money to the market. Equity and bond markets have been diverging for sometime Link: https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/JS5fWrkWAiorKZk2YoJ4qJ/Equities-and-bonds-a-tale-of-two-markets.html . Whereas equities are looking at corporate profits bond dealers are factoring in global risks to the Indian economy and the possibility of inflation. "The higher fiscal deficit and rising global commodity prices may stoke the fires of inflation Link: https://www.livemint.com/Money/Mo0rDd05TR45N3kl5oHWQN/Beware-the-ire-of-bond-vigilantes.html , prompting the central bank to raise rates in coming months, bond markets fear," wrote T Kundu, warning the government of annoying the "bond vigilantes". The Prime Minister is spending more on subsidies Link: https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-02-13/with-his-eye-on-elections-modi-lets-india-s-subsidy-bill-surge with an eye on elections next year. Taxes have been increased stealthily in the form of cess Link: https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/plYZhCRC8DJLPPlXcZC9eI/A-criminal-breach-of-trust.html and this money has been used for revenue expenditure Link: http://www.economicsdiscussion.net/expenditure/revenue-expenditure-and-capital-expenditure-of-india-notes/749 . The people maybe fooled but not the bond market. It is showing its displeasure.

At least we know what to expect. Link: https://indiadying.blogspot.com/2018/03/at-least-we-know-what-to-expect.html

What happens to India if there is an all out trade war? "India is such a minuscule part of the global trade Link: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/markets/stocks/news/trade-war-breaks-out-but-will-it-really-hurt-india/articleshow/63426316.cms . I do not know any amount of trade war can harm it. It may harm a few sectors here or there, but I do not think anybody is looking at a really bad scenario of Indian exporters. I do not even think we are on the radar of most companies barring the US for IT executives," said A Srivastava. Ouch. China had a trade surplus with the US Link: https://ustr.gov/countries-regions/china-mongolia-taiwan/peoples-republic-china of $375 billion, Mexico had a surplus of $71 billion, Japan $68.8 billion and Germany $64.2 billion, while India had a surplus of only $22.9 billion. It is only 1.9% of US trade making it the ninth largest trading partner of the US. So, what is our fear? "Our concern is withdrawal from equity markets by global investors." "If liquidity is not good our poor fundamentals depress it further." Poor fundamentals? Only a few days back everyone was celebrating a growth of 7.2% in the third quarter Link: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/economy/indicators/indias-gdp-growth-rises-to-7-2-in-december-quarter/articleshow/63111337.cms , making India the fastest growing economy in the world. Gross value added was up, core sector growth was up, gross fixed capital formation was up, and manufacturing was still positive. "The next bear market is going to be the worst in my lifetime Link: https://www.livemint.com/Companies/AktFDseH33gGGYyMq0nzlM/Jim-Rogers-says-trade-war-is-making-his-bearish-view-even-da.html -- just because of the debt -- but if we also have a trade war, it's going to be worse than a disaster." said J Rogers. "China's a huge buyer of American agriculture, so of course that is the obvious place to hit back because that hurts Mr Trump the worst." If China stops buying the US may dump agricultural products on world markets depressing commodity prices. Indian farmers are already suffering from low commodity prices Link: https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/h7Zmim3PJHrkaDRh0Z3CXN/Why-are-farmers-restless.html and rising costs of production, wrote Prof Himanshu. Farmers are calling for free markets Link: https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/gSYRo9belsuk97BKh4dxcK/Indian-farmers-call-for-free-markets.html so that they can sell the produce where the price is highest, as well as export them if they get higher prices internationally. The government faces an impossible fiscal trinity Link: https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/M93lEbI6laCXgPKOaCVUKL/An-impossible-fiscal-trinity-for-Arun-Jaitley.html . It cannot allow high food prices as that will cause inflation and it cannot keep food prices low by paying farmers directly because that will increase its fiscal deficit. Farmers are forced to sell to middlemen, who buy low and sell high, and agricultural land cannot be used for other purposes so farmers cannot sell out Link: https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/Ur1gpECTWdd3VnbpuuUD9O/India-needs-to-trust-its-farmers-and-set-them-free.html , wrote Prof S Rajagopalan. If global prices fall farmers will be hit very hard. India faces risks similar to 2013, wrote VA Nageswaran. Our trade deficit is high, fiscal deficit cannot be contained Link: https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/2jSClIJ3PhP3ZPMnTOgoaN/Will-the-risks-in-2018-resemble-those-of-2013.html and bond yields have risen over 100 basis points. Banks are still revealing the extent of bad loans. Risks will get multiplied because general elections Link: https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/a8okKjgSlm19e68YwTqdvK/The-return-of-political-risk.html must be held by May 2019 and there are elections to key state assemblies Link: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_elections_in_India before that, wrote M Chakravarty. So, even though we will not be affected directly by a trade war between China and the US we will be cooked anyway. That is so reassuring.

The dollar is making us nervous. Link: https://indiadying.blogspot.com/2018/03/the-dollar-is-making-us-nervous.html

"On 24 January, Team Trump made official its plan to end the 23-year-old strong dollar policy Link: https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/OhMpWZnwHBdjsERCJWtZrN/Asias-dollar-problem-just-got-worse.html ," wrote W Pesek. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin rocked the currency world when he said: 'A weaker dollar is good for us as it relates to trade and opportunities'." That is surely not true. In December 2008 theFederal Funds rate was reduced to  zero to 0.25%  Link: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-fed-history-factbox/factbox-u-s-federal-reserve-interest-rate-policy-a-brief-history-idUSKCN0RH2B720150917 and, at the same time, the Federal Reserve resorted to a bond buying program, known as quantitative easing, to massively increase liquidity Link: http://www.bbc.com/news/business-29778331 in the market, expanding its balance sheet to $4.44 trillion. The dollar fell against the Euro, reaching nearly 1.60 Link: http://www.macrotrends.net/2548/euro-dollar-exchange-rate-historical-chart at one point before strengthening to near parity by 2016. Zero interest rate, or ZIRP, was criticised because it failed to stimulate inflation Link: https://www.investopedia.com/articles/investing/031815/what-zero-interestrate-policy-zirp.asp , but increased asset prices instead. The reason the dollar became stronger maybe because other central banks resorted to negative interest rate policy, or NIRP, Link: https://www.bloomberg.com/quicktake/negative-interest-rates so that by 2016 Switzerland, Denmark, Sweden, Japan, and the 19 countries of the Eurozone all had negative interest rates. On the other hand, Trump appointed Lawrence Kudlow as his top economic adviser. "Kudlow is a supply-side ideologue, a cheerleader for the dogma of low taxes, less regulation, free trade and a strong currency." So all is not lost. When central banks compete to go lower than each other they cancel out any benefits that may have occurred. Since ZIRP and NIRP are not working maybe it is time for RIRP, or Restrictive Interest Rate Policy Link: https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/qq697IFT01gMeqTNBP5LGN/ZIRP-NIRP-and-RIRP.html , mocked VA Nageswaran. The Federal Open Market Committee, under new Chairman Jerome Powell, just increased the funds rate by 25 basis points Link: http://www.latimes.com/business/la-fi-federal-reserve-powell-20180321-story.html to 1.5-1.75%. Although, inflation is still low in the US some members of the FOMC favor an extra rate hike this year which may cause problems in Asia Link: https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/Ewe104HdqZMVkULE2ftNNP/Feds-dots-are-knock-knock-knocking-on-Asias-doors.html as fund managers transfer money from Asian bonds to the US. That will make the dollar stronger relative to other currencies. A strong growth in the US will pull other economies higher Link: https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/YMRg9zJSXMK9yvRyeiOLEO/Jerome-Powell-moves-to-normalize-US-monetary-policy.html , but higher interest rates will put severe strain on companies which have borrowed in dollars. Asian countries hold huge amounts of dollar reserves. China added $127 billion in US treasuries,while India added $27 billion Link: https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/bBzfiZD4UFIsmYCwfteJjI/A-bloodbath-in-US-Treasuries-is-the-next-worry-for-Asia.html recently. If the dollar falls the value of their holdings will also drop. Foreign portfolio investors have pulled half a billion dollars out of Indian bonds Link: https://blogs.economictimes.indiatimes.com/et-editorials/fed-rate-hike-makes-inflation-a-concern/ in the last three weeks. If US interest rate goes up faster more money could leave which would make the rupee weaker and increase inflation. Bond yields havesurged by 100 basis points in the last six months Link: https://www.livemint.com/Money/oQn20CyJqkAbCdCUda90vL/Dear-government-pay-up-to-get-a-good-demand-for-your-bonds.html , wrote A Iyer. This will raise the government's borrowing costs. A weak dollar hurts Asian trade, while a strong dollar hurts currencies. How to stay in balance?

Foreigners are welcome to take over. Link: https://indiadying.blogspot.com/2018/03/foreigners-are-allowed-to-take-over.html

"The Lok Sabha has passed without debate, a bill that will exempt political parties from scrutiny Link: https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/now-foreign-poll-funding-wont-be-scrutinised/articleshow/63358451.cms of funds they have received from abroad since 1976," was a news report on 19 March 2018. Any company with less than 50% foreign share holding will no longer be seen as a foreign company. The most important point about this shameful legislation is that all politicians were in agreement. "With the Finance Bill retrospective amendment, even foreigners may be able to fund politics in India Link: https://www.livemint.com/Opinion/uPLzx8yDc0AxlXOsD97KoM/The-unfinished-agenda-of-electoral-reforms.html , who knows," wrote A Ranade. India's enemies can now form political parties through local agents and channel money from abroad. Could it be a disadvantage to have no opponents? Link: https://indiadying.blogspot.com/2018/03/is-it-advantage-to-have-no-opponents.html

As expected, the Federal Reserve raised its Funds Rate by 25 basis points Link: https://www.cnbc.com/2018/03/21/fed-hikes-rates-by-a-quarter-point-at-chair-powells-first-meeting.html to 1.5-1.75% yesterday. Minutes of the Federal Open Market Committee meeting showed a split between those who want three rate rises this year against those who want four. The puzzle is that both core and headline inflation is predicted to remain at 1.9% Link: https://www.thestreet.com/story/14530630/1/three-big-takeaways-from-fed-chairman-jerome-powell-first-rate-meeting.html , below the Fed's benchmark rate of 2%, even though growth is expected to remain strong and unemployment rate to drop from 4.1% at present to 3.8% this year and 3.6% in 2019. Members expressed concern about a trade war which raises a doubt about future interest rate rises. US stocks finished slightly lower Link: http://www.business-standard.com/article/markets/markets-live-bse-sensex-nse-nifty-indices-asian-markets-us-markets-118032200173_1.html but Asian markets are mixed this morning with Japan and India rising Link: http://money.cnn.com/data/world_markets/asia/ . Surprisingly, the dollar dropped sharply Link: http://www.business-standard.com/article/international/after-25-bps-rate-hike-by-fed-reserve-us-dollar-slides-stocks-end-lowe-118032200113_1.html , presumably because traders expected a more hawkish tone from the FOMC. After having increased tariffs on steel and aluminium imports Link: https://www.thehindubusinessline.com/news/world/trump-imposes-heavy-tariffs-on-steel-and-aluminium-imports-into-us/article22992419.ece , Trump is about to announce $60 billion worth of tariffs on Chinese products Link: https://in.reuters.com/article/usa-trade-tariffs-china/u-s-expected-to-impose-up-to-60-billion-in-china-tariffs-by-friday-sources-idINKBN1GV31M , in retaliation for China flouting intellectual property rights of US companies. The US controlled nearly three quarters of global steel output Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/x5XwLBr8bUQ72ys9P0IgjJ/The-US-has-squandered-its-steel-superiority.html at the end of World War II, wrote Prof S Mihm, but lost that advantage for not adopting new technologies, like basic-oxygen or electric-arc methods. There are many supporters of China in the US. A new book claims that Obama changed rules to help friends make a lot of money Link: https://www.foxbusiness.com/politics/obama-biden-cronies-made-billions-off-china-trade-deals-and-regulatory-policies-report from China trade. Trade wars are a definite possibility, wrote R Singhal, because the US is subverting the World Trade Organization by holding up appointment of judges to its appellate committee Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/YwOpekTejlFyZ1I8STiBEM/The-risk-of-trade-wars-becomes-a-reality.html and walking away from trade deals. Economists are divided on whether there is a winner in tariff wars and what an optimum tariff should be, but Trump could gain by gaining concessions Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/KTBeiDoB6QKzKimf7WgxCJ/Donald-Trump-trade-wars-and-optimum-tariffs.html from trading partners, wrote Prof V Dahejia. The Communist Party in China amended its constitution to allow Xi Jinping to remain president for life. He probably has to, having used the excuse of corruption Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/a71fRRF3kkpBqUQqbBJVZN/Xi-Jinping-is-unmaking-Deng-Xiaopings-China.html to jail anyone who could challenge his power. He used very tough language against other nations Link: http://www.scmp.com/news/china/policies-politics/article/2137914/xi-jinpings-speech-wrap-chinas-two-sessions-after at the party Congress. Whether he will accede to Trump or precipitate a trade war remains to be seen, but having thumped his chest he probably has to be seen to be tough. European banks are still hampered by 760 billion Euros in bad loans Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/ufdgzv47XAiktlzdlggwXL/Europe-only-halfway-to-healthier-banks.html , wrote F Giugliano, so Europe has a lot to lose from trade wars. Will China encourage its rogue friends, Pakistan and North Korea, to make trouble? The present Cold War is much more dangerous than the previous one Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/bOnMplIjNXCV6RyXJDlydJ/The-21st-century-Cold-War-is-heating-up.html between the US and the Soviet Union, wrote Prof WPS Sidhu. A Cold War plus a trade war could become a real war. Trump has a lot of opponents at home, Xi has none. But, Xi has a lot more to lose.

Tuesday, March 20, 2018

Why would they give up the golden goose? Link: https://indiadying.blogspot.com/2018/03/why-would-they-give-up-golden-goose.html

Bad loans in Indian banks will peak at Rs 12-14 trillion Link: https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/india-3rd-only-to-greece-italy-in-bad-debt-kotak/articleshow/63388749.cms , third only to Greece and Italy, said U Kotak, CEO of Kotak Mahindra Bank. That is about 20% of all loans disbursed by banks. Most of the bad loans are in public sector banks. Most frauds apparently take place during economic booms when asset prices soar. India's economy boomed from 2003-08 Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/2hLkRxtfw4JWumOLHPScYN/The-roots-of-the-current-banking-crisis.html , followed by prolonged fiscal and monetary stimulus to mitigate effects of the subprime crisis, wrote M Chakravarty. In 2007 the economic growth touched 9.8% Link: https://knoema.com/atlas/India/Real-GDP-growth of GDP. In 1991, when economic liberalisation began Link: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Economic_liberalisation_in_India , bank lending was 19.2% of GDP, went up to 25% in 2001-02, and then doubled to 51.64% by 2016-17. The growth was in public sector banks, with loans to infrastructure increasing from 1.1% of non-food credit in 1998 to 12.8% in 2017. When the growth rate fell government banks were left holding 68.3% of all bad loans. Managers of public sector banks know that they will not be sacked and thatthe government will not allow these banks to fail Link: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/industry/banking/finance/banking/public-sector-banking-mess-is-here-to-stay-and-this-is-why/articleshow/63274984.cms , so they follow government orders to finance large projects, wrote Prof N Kaushal. Bad loans at Indian banks are among the worst in G20 nations and worse than other emerging nations Link: http://www.livemint.com/Industry/55l4XnriGrAYQr87EP58PJ/Why-Indias-banking-sector-is-among-the-most-vulnerable-amon.html , because of low capital adequacy ratio, wrote T Kundu. Why do frauds happen at public sector banks? Because officials are appointed by other officials of the government, have no incentive to succeed or fear of being punished for failure, and politicians force them to give loans to dodgy businessmen Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/vLNm12SOfwrKUc95q6yr1N/Privatize-public-sector-banks-to-prevent-future-Nirav-Modis.html in exchange for campaign finance, wrote Prof S Rajagopalan. The only solution is to privatize them. R Singhal gave a list of failing private banks which were rescued by the government by forcing public sector banks to merge with them Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/ep5zwxjy8OlyrB9HOljmdO/Why-banking-frauds-are-so-frequent-at-PSU-banks.html to protect depositors from losing their savings. No matter which party comes to power, politicians will never give up control of public sector banks because they can use bank deposits to please their vote bank. The Congress spent Rs 600 billion in farm loans waiver in 2008 Link: http://www.livemint.com/Politics/XeGU40jlsHGKrfwfJK1ccL/Govt-announces-Rs60000crore-loan-waiver-for-farmers.html , to win general elections in 2009, the present BJP government may end up spending up to Rs 3.1 trillion Link: http://www.indiaspend.com/cover-story/india-now-faces-49-1-bn-farm-loan-waivers-16-times-2017-budget-for-rural-roads-96930 , or $49.1 billion, to try and win state elections this year and general elections next year. Public sector banks are having to support the government's affordable housing scheme by lending money to the poor. Small loans up to Rs 200,000 could turn out to be India's own subprime crisis Link: http://www.livemint.com/Money/USgBBYjlKvUJkujT1kxx4K/The-subprime-signs-of-Indias-affordable-housing.html . Better salaries and proper evaluation of officers before promotion Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/qLXtQU4dafnKw8nztu2G0K/Just-two-things-can-fix-public-sector-banks-problems.html would be a good start to root out corruption in banks, wrote T Bandopadhyay. "Even as the state provides violent support to those who benefit from such predatory capitalism, often violating the human rights of its citizens, particularly its poor, the market begins to function like a bureaucratic machine dominated by big business, and the state begins to function like the market, where everything is available for sale at a price Link: https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/niravs-dont-surprise-us-for-scam-is-indias-seventh-season/articleshow/62975709.cms ," said the Supreme Court in 2011. Banks are the goose that lay golden eggs. Why would politicians give them up?

They are escaping because they can. Link: https://indiadying.blogspot.com/2018/03/they-are-escaping-because-they-can.html

According to a report by Morgan Stanley, 23,000 dollar millionaires have left India since 2014 Link: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/economy/indicators/23000-dollar-millionaires-have-left-india-since-2014/articleshow/63358087.cms . In absolute terms India is second to China which lost 38,000 dollar millionaires since 2014 but in percentage terms India is the highest with 2.1%, with France at 1.3% and China at 1.1%. "While some of the millionaires leaving may be desirable given the corruption drive Link: https://www.moneycontrol.com/news/business/economy/morgan-stanleys-ruchir-sharma-regulatory-overkill-biggest-risk-to-india-in-2018-2530651.html , we have to be careful we do not throw the baby out with the bathwater," said R Sharma, author of the report. "Which is collateral damage of the regulatory overkill." He could be referring to Vijay Mallya, who was allowed to fly out of Delhi Link: https://www.dailyo.in/business/vijay-mallya-kingfisher-airlines-money-laundering-uk-extradition-defaulter-cbi/story/1/18599.html in first class, and Sanjay Bhandari who left India without his passport Link: https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/arms-dealer-sanjay-bhandaris-flight-without-passport-stumps-sleuths/articleshow/56162758.cms and has disappeared since. UK is a favorite destination of those charged with financial crimes fleeing India. Other destinations are Dubai, which has no income tax Link: http://www.livingindubai.org/dubai-taxation/ , and Singapore, which has low direct taxes for individuals Link: https://www.startupdecisions.com.sg/singapore/taxes/current-tax-rates-and-tax-system/ and companies. It maybe a good that corrupt people are leaving India, "but there is a major side effect of this because at the end of the day you need your own domestic people to invest in your country, which is very important. Foreign investment is important but domestic participation, domestic investors make a nation going forward." "....if you go to Dubai today you are likely to meet more Indians out there than in a restaurant in Bombay, Delhi....so you can see where the capital is fleeing, what the magnets for capital are Dubai, Singapore, US and UK," said Sharma in an interview. All these countries have tough laws which they enforce vigorously. If these people are so corrupt why are they choosing these places? Because taxes are collected under false pretenses in India Link: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/politics-and-nation/view-private-funding-of-public-failures/articleshow/63366905.cms , wrote R Saran. Indians have to pay privately for basic services like clean water, education, and security for which we have already paid taxes. The government has collected Rs 2.5 trillion in education cess since 2004 but our education system is one of the worst in the world Link: http://www.financialexpress.com/opinion/ranking-matters-indias-education-system-has-so-many-flaws-is-it-even-worse-than-rwanda/862513/ . Parents have to pay over Rs 250,000 for nursery education for one child Link: http://bangaloremirror.indiatimes.com/bangalore/others/bangalore/others/rs-202000-isnt-fake-news-theres-more-/articleshow/63337940.cms . Taxpayers get no pension, healthcare or care for the elderly. Politicians and civil servants do. Lack of water supply led to one death recently Link: https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/delhi/how-water-wars-have-turned-this-colony-into-battleground/articleshow/63358434.cms , with the Meteorology department predicting a hotter than usual summer Link: http://www.financialexpress.com/india-news/brace-for-a-hotter-summer-this-year-imd-predicts-warmer-pre-monsoon-season-in-india/1084191/ . Perhaps, the worst thing is that rules keep changing as the government reacts Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/2jSClIJ3PhP3ZPMnTOgoaN/Will-the-risks-in-2018-resemble-those-of-2013.html to circumstances rather than enacting long term policies which can create a stable environment for business, wrote VA Nageswaran. Singapore has announced plans to raise GST by 2% after 2021 Link: https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-02-19/singapore-plans-to-boost-gst-to-9-as-spending-pressures-mount , giving enough time for everyone to adjust. That is why Singapore is voted the best place Link: https://www.cnbc.com/2017/09/26/these-are-the-top-10-countries-for-expats.html for expats, while India is one of the worst Link: https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/why-expats-dont-want-to-live-in-india/articleshow/60433029.cms . Those who can are escaping. We are trapped.

Economist see the bigger picture, people see themselves. Link: https://indiadying.blogspot.com/2018/03/economist-see-bigger-picture-people-see.html

Increased tariffs on steel and aluminium imports Link: https://www.thehindubusinessline.com/news/world/trump-imposes-heavy-tariffs-on-steel-and-aluminium-imports-into-us/article22992419.ece into the US by President Donald Trump has unleashed a storm of condemnation and derision. High current account deficit isbecause Americans are saving too little Link: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/international/business/how-trumps-tariff-move-will-only-make-matters-worse-for-the-american-economy/articleshow/63290628.cms , so raising tariffs will only make goods more expensive for them, without much effect on the deficit, wrote SA Aiyer. "Globalization wasn't supposed to end like this Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/r65C0BUuBIQPae7Z2fliQP/Donald-Trump-fires-first-shot-against-globalization.html ," wrote M Chakravarty, wistfully. "Globalization had shifted production en masse to the poorer countries, where goods were manufactured and tradable services provided at rock bottom rates. Many poor countries benefited and millions were lifted out of poverty. The low cost of production kept inflation down in the developed economies, in turn enabling central banks to keep interest rates low. The expansion of global supply chains to the Third World reduced wage pressure in developed countries, pushing up profits." Workers in the US lost out because of this shift to low wage countries and Trump tapped into this anger Link: http://www.thehindu.com/opinion/lead/a-working-class-act-in-america/article21432336.ece , wrote Prof D Gupta. The US should refrain from 'neo-protectionism' Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/bbzRLxZZR8j1dGRdppS97N/Americas-dangerous-neoprotectionism.html because loss of manufacturing jobs is because of automation, wrote Prof K Basu. Instead those who lose jobs should be educated in new technologies so that they can adapt to the new working environment. If everyone had the brains to be a professor of economics they would not be doing manual jobs, would they? Writing about increasing inequality, Prof Basu criticises recent tax cuts by Trump and suggests a kind ofuniversal basic income for everyone Link: https://www.bloomberg.com/view/articles/2018-01-23/a-basic-income-for-everyone-it-s-not-a-crazy-idea . This can be done by giving everyone a share in profits of the economy Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/FnwDqaEMcYGHBuoZ51dUUN/Inequality-in-the-21st-century.html . How are these profits to be calculated? The US runs a trade deficit with the rest of the world which amounted to $566 billion in 2017 Link: https://www.thebalance.com/u-s-trade-deficit-causes-effects-trade-partners-3306276 . The national debt of the United States exceeds $21 trillion Link: http://www.usdebtclock.org/ . Although most of the debt is within the US, and the US can print dollars, the interest payment on such a humongous debt is substantial. Where are the profits? Companies have been taking advantage of free movement of capital by holding cash offshore Link: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/2017-overseas-profits/ and avoiding taxes in the US. Following tax cuts, criticised by Prof Basu, US companies have been paying cash bonuses to their workers Link: https://www.cnbc.com/2018/01/26/us-companies-that-have-announced-bonuses-investments-after-tax-cut.html , and will have to pay billions in taxes on cash held overseas Link: http://money.cnn.com/2018/01/02/investing/us-tax-companies-overseas-cash/index.html . Ronald Reagan's policies weremuch more protectionist than Trump's Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/HWlQB6aTlp88o8VS1t2rVJ/Donald-Trumps-trade-policy-pale-in-front-of-Ronald-Reagans.html , wrote Prof D Rodrik, but Reagan consulted with allies while Trump is unilateral. Low wages and low inflation encouraged central banks to keep interest rates low, leading to a massive asset price bubble Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/iwKvH00H1NVbT4X2ruyVxL/Do-valuations-really-matter.html , wrote VA Nageswaran. It is not about numbers but about how people feel. Perhaps economists are too clever to understand.

You cannot be poor and rich at the same time, can you? Link: https://indiadying.blogspot.com/2018/03/you-cannot-be-poor-and-rich-at-same.html

Prime Minister Narendra Modi listed achievements of his government as inclusive development Link: http://businessworld.in/article/-We-Will-Achieve-the-Dream-of-New-India-by-2022-PM-Modi/17-03-2018-143776/ and steps to revive stalled projects. Inauguration of gas cracker project in Assam in 2016 and revival of sick fertilizer units in Gorakhpur in UP, Sindri in Jharkhand, Barauni in Bihar and Talcher in Odisha will stimulate infrastructure activity in allied sectors. These units were sick because they were making losses so whether they will become profitable or waste taxpayer money is not clear. Under his Ujjwala scheme 34.8 million households have been provided cooking gas connections and is to cover 80 million households in this year's budget. He forgot to mention that many of those provided with free gas connections cannot afford to refill their cylinders Link: https://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/lpg-scheme-for-poor-running-out-of-gas/story-t4SSXDV9tkDWCYoyKURtKP.html and so are back to cooking with wood. Under Saubhagya scheme the government is to spend Rs 160 billion to provide electricity to all households. The Uday project was supposed to rescue electricity distribution companies, which are controlled by state governments, from huge piles of debt, but reduced demand for electricity is causing debts Link: http://www.livemint.com/Money/vQsqL1lhxUlvxVYVER912I/UDAY-no-panacea-for-power-sector-woes.html to increase. Toilets may have been provided to 80 million houses but people still prefer to defecate outdoors Link: https://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/swachh-bharat-battles-rural-india-s-belief-that-defecating-in-open-is-better/story-o1WxJDlwkLu9LEQQst9saK.html . Toilets are seen as dirty and thereforeshould not be part of the living space Link: http://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-india-17377895 . And, toilets can function only if there is a reliable water supply Link: https://thewire.in/women/modi-rajasthan-womens-day . The latest wheeze is to provide health insurance to 500 million Indians for inpatient treatment Link: http://www.financialexpress.com/budget/budget-2018-for-health-modi-government-needs-to-strengthen-healthcare-spending/1037832/ costing up to Rs 500,000 each. Trouble is, although talk maybe cheap schemes cost money, and fiscal deficit is already predicted to be 3.5% of GDP Link: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/economy/finance/india-fy2019-fiscal-deficit-to-come-in-at-3-5-of-gdp-report/articleshow/62804874.cms , instead of 3.3%, as promised earlier. So where is the money going to come from to finance all these schemes? From taxes. The Goods and Services Tax Link: https://cleartax.in/s/gst-law-goods-and-services-tax was supposed to combine all indirect taxes to make it easy for businesses and make goods cheaper by removing cascading central and state taxes. In reality,it has too many slabs Link: https://cleartax.in/s/gst-law-goods-and-services-tax , with added cess, which makes it too complicated, said a World Bank report. With a system is so complicated collections have fallen by Rs 340 billion Link: http://www.gconnect.in/gst-news/tax-evasion-fears-deepen-government-fix-rs-34000-crore-mismatch-gst-math.html . Target for direct taxes has been raised from Rs 9.80 trillion to Rs 10.05 trillion Link: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/economy/finance/taxmen-asked-to-step-up-collections-to-meet-higher-target/articleshow/63071112.cms , so we can expect extreme tax terrorism. Customs duty has been increased across a wide range of products Link: https://www.bloombergquint.com/union-budget-2018/2018/02/01/union-budget-2018-the-list-of-items-with-changes-in-custom-duty , with the excuse of protecting Indian industries. Since we import almost everything we use this will increase costs.Exporters are suffering because the government is unwilling Link: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/economy/policy/view-the-more-things-change-the-more-they-remain-the-same-just-look-at-gsts-whipping-boys/articleshow/63101224.cms , or unable, to refund their money. And yet the economy grew by 7.2% in the third quarter. Does that mean we are getting richer? Index of Industrial Production grew by 7.47% Link: http://www.livemint.com/Money/veVNEz6VGgC5R3zLGbQmdJ/Inflation-down-GDP-growth-up-Goldilocks-is-back-but-will-s.html but retail inflation fell to 4.44%. Private final consumption expenditure fell Link: http://www.livemint.com/Money/EK4mf9EFITBHFvFTgfywGM/10-questions-answered-by-Q3-GDP-data.html from 6.6% to 5.5% and Service PMI fell to 47.8 in February Link: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/economy/indicators/services-pmi-falls-to-47-8-in-february-from-51-7-in-january/articleshow/63167104.cms , which shows a contraction. So people are getting poorer while the government is spending more on the poor.

Why is elite bad for India, and not China? Link: https://indiadying.blogspot.com/2018/03/why-is-elite-bad-for-india-and-not-china.html

"It is no hyperbole to say that the well-intentioned Right to Education (RTE) Act, 2009, has been a disastrous experiment. Contrary to its avowed intent, its effect has been to deprive millions of children of their right to education Link: https://blogs.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/toi-edit-page/when-ideology-overcame-sense-rte-imposes-a-bureaucratic-grotesquely-inefficient-regime-starving-our-children-of-good-education/ by closing down schools," wrote Prof GG Kingdon. Why? The RTE Act lays down stringent infrastructure requirements for unaided private schools, while exempting government schools. Small private schools used by poor children were forced to close. The Act forces private schools to reserve 25% of their seats for poor children which has emptied government schools. "In 2015-16, Rajasthan, Maharashtra and Chhattisgarh alone closed 24,000 government schools where total school enrolment had fallen below 10 students." So these states face double expense of paying for the reserved seats in private schools as well as salaries for government teachers. Hence they close small private schools to push children back to government schools. But, was the RTE Act well-intentioned? The Act promises "free and compulsory" education for all children Link: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Right_of_Children_to_Free_and_Compulsory_Education_Act,_2009 between the ages of 6 and 14 years, but in reality the cost was a tax on the middle class who saw fees for their children sky-rocketing Link: https://www.hindustantimes.com/delhi-news/cost-of-education-in-delhi-tripled-in-7-years/story-49o3kHPuK3nX4Ve8GVtttK.html , to compensate for reserved seats. Without help at home children of illiterate parents would find it difficult to compete so exams were stopped and promotion was guaranteed. Since there was no requirement to learn there was no requirement to teach. The Annual Status of Education Report, or ASER, for 2017 states that 25% of children between 14 and 18 years of age cannot read basic text and57% are unable to do basic division Link: http://indianexpress.com/article/opinion/columns/annual-status-of-education-report-aser-right-to-education-act-best-schools-5074577/ , wrote Prof K Basu. States want tobring back exams and detention for students Link: http://www.business-standard.com/article/pti-stories/states-want-review-of-no-detention-policy-in-schools-panel-118021201472_1.html who fail. Why are politicians against private schools? Because they are seen to be profiteering from education Link: http://www.livemint.com/Sundayapp/qHoFCwxUpOdaEesYFA2h2K/Its-time-to-reform-the-RTE-Act.html and serving only the elite. To solve this problem could we learn from China which is wealthy and communist at the same time? China has set up "key schools" which are "elite schools with much better quality teachers, infrastructure and other facilities compared to normal schools," wrote Prof S Mundle. "A second category of elite schools, called 'choice schools', are preferred schools where, again, rich children can get admitted by paying hefty fees." "The ring-fenced supply chain of the most capable students Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/uhxxghgjkNlNgw2Wd1abzN/The-paradox-of-weakness-and-strength-in-Chinese-education.html has been established all the way from primary and secondary school education to graduate studies in colleges and universities." So, while democratic India is dumbing down education communist China is creating elites. The difference in wealth can only grow.

Is free trade really free? Link: https://indiadying.blogspot.com/2018/03/is-free-trade-really-free.html

Earlier this month President Donald Trump announced higher tariffs on steel and aluminium imports Link: http://time.com/5192148/donald-trump-announces-tariffs-on-steel-aluminum/ into the US, igniting a storm of criticism. "When a country (USA) is losing many billions of dollars on trade with virtually every country it does business with, trade wars are good Link: https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-03-01/trump-is-said-to-delay-decision-on-steel-and-aluminum-tariffs , and easy to win," he tweeted. "Example, when we are down $100 billion with a certain country and they get cute, they don't trade anymore -- we win big. It's easy." At over $375 billion, the US had the biggest trade deficit Link: https://www.census.gov/foreign-trade/balance/c5700.html with China in 2017. Trump has asked China to reduce the imbalance by $100 billion Link: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trade/u-s-pressing-china-to-cut-trade-surplus-by-100-billion-white-house-idUSKCN1GQ26L or face higher tariffs. China lovers predict that the US will lose in a face off with China. China can stop soya bean and corn beef imports hitting farmers in Mississippi, Missourie and other US states. "Xi could impose exit taxes on goods manufactured in China in ways that savage Apple, General Motors and Wal-Mart. Canceling Boeing orders could cost more than 180,000 American jobs overnight Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/qHxJOOkFaVJMfINdgz2MRP/Forget-Donald-Trump-Xi-Jinping-is-the-real-wild-card.html . Beijing could dump its $1.2 trillion of US government bonds, sending yields skyrocketing," wrote W Pesek. Indeed, China could do all those things and more but can it withstand the effects of its actions. Canceling food imports from the US will reduce choice of suppliers, increasing prices. Canceling Boeing planes leaves just Airbus which will surely try to maximize profits. Dumping US securities may weaken the dollar but what will China buy instead? If it buys yuan, its currency will become very strong, increasing the prices of its goods and decimating exports. Xi Jinping has crowned himself emperor Link: http://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-china-43361276 which has surely multiplied the number of people who would like to have his head. "The main reason for the big US CAD (current account deficit) is not unfair trade," wrote SA Aiyer. "It lies in the relatively low savings rate Link: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/international/business/how-trumps-tariff-move-will-only-make-matters-worse-for-the-american-economy/articleshow/63290628.cms of the US." Apparently, CAD is the difference investment and savings in an economy and in the case of the US savings rate has fallen to a low of 2.6% of disposable income Link: https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-01-26/why-the-savings-rate-is-a-reason-to-worry-about-2018-u-s-growth . Higher tariffs will increase prices of goods, takingretail inflation, which is too low at present Link: https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-03-13/guts-of-u-s-cpi-data-show-key-inflation-gauge-weakest-in-years , to 2% and allowing the Federal Reserve to increase interest rate Link: https://www.investopedia.com/ask/answers/12/inflation-interest-rate-relationship.asp . Higher returns will tempt people to save more and thus reduce CAD Link: https://www.economicshelp.org/blog/21724/economics/relationship-between-the-interest-rate-and-saving-ratio/ . Trump could actuallywin according to the theory of 'optimum tariff' Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/KTBeiDoB6QKzKimf7WgxCJ/Donald-Trump-trade-wars-and-optimum-tariffs.html which is "defined as tariff that maximizes national welfare", wrote Prof V Dahejia. Even if there is a trade war the US most likely will come out ahead. Rich countries have been erecting barriers to free trade by bringing up labor laws and Justin Trudeau is using women's rights and minorities Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/9MdjfnPrGFKNlSkRPuryHJ/Justin-Trudeaus-false-fixation-with-progressive-trade.html because they are fashionable, wrote Prof Dahejia. India has lost heavily from trade agreements Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/ylSO0uM8RM8LnA6FGRjdJM/Trade-agreements-Theory-and-reality.html which reduced tariffs on goods but did not allow free movement of people. Free trade is not really free. It is a myth by vested interests.

We hope, but we can't be sure. Link: https://indiadying.blogspot.com/2018/03/we-hope-but-we-cant-be-sure.html

"All is well when economic growth is high and inflation is low Link: http://www.livemint.com/Money/veVNEz6VGgC5R3zLGbQmdJ/Inflation-down-GDP-growth-up-Goldilocks-is-back-but-will-s.html ," wrote A Iyer. "The Index of Industrial Production grew by 7.47% in January, with manufacturing maintaining its impressive pace of expansion at 8.69%." Retail inflation fell to 4.44% in February Link: http://www.firstpost.com/business/retail-inflation-at-4-month-low-of-4-44-in-february-on-cheaper-food-fuel-4386889.html from 5.07% in January.Wholesale inflation fell to 2.48% in February Link: http://www.thehindu.com/business/Economy/wholesale-inflation-eases-to-7-month-low-of-248-in-february/article23238595.ece , the lowest in 7 months. Stock market indices in India have been brought down by public sector banks which are yet to clear bad loans from their books. Bad loans may amount to Rs 9.5 trillion Link: http://www.firstpost.com/business/bank-npa-trend-in-7-charts-bad-loans-at-state-run-banks-may-be-peaking-select-private-peers-see-rise-4218813.html , or more, as banks are forced to write them down by the Reserve Bank. Unwilling to lend to industry, banks have resorted to lending to individuals. Most of the retail loans are unsecured Link: http://www.livemint.com/Money/Nracq59H6uDqwnhV4qrRQO/How-risky-is-the-retail-loan-book-of-banks.html which makes them highly risky, wrote A Iyer. Out of "every Rs 100 worth of retail loan that banks lent between April and January of 2017-18, nearly Rs 50 went towards unsecured personal loans. Add credit card outstandings and it swells to Rs 80." The GDP grew by 7.2% in the third quarter Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/I3JERG5RZA3NLKIjrI4YUI/The-Indian-economy-is-gathering-momentum.html and core Gross Value Added grew by 7.4%. Consumer spending is getting weaker but investment is increasing, though most of it is brown field and not green field investment Link: https://www.investopedia.com/terms/b/brownfield.asp . Why is investment increasing when consumer spending is not growing as strongly? It can only be due to increasing exports. But, India's exports of goods and services are stagnant, even though other Asian nations have picked up smartly as growth has quickened in the global economy. As a share of GDP exports are at the same level Link: http://www.livemint.com/Money/1rtRspDiWltNknYmaqAClO/Even-without-trade-wars-Indian-exports-have-been-stagnant.html as they were in the September quarter in 2005. "If the relationship between between India's exports and world growth returns to that in the boom phase, and if world growth in 2018 is as projected by the IMF, then it could add another 0.5 percentage point to growth," said the last Economic Survey. True, but the Services Purchasing Managers' Index fell to 47.8 in February Link: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/economy/indicators/services-pmi-falls-to-47-8-in-february-from-51-7-in-january/articleshow/63167104.cms from 51.7 in January. Anything below 50 shows a contraction. Imports of electronic goods, especially mobile phones Link: http://www.livemint.com/Money/vuLmJx8vyCzWpDMGMzZLnN/The-curious-case-of-rising-electronic-imports.html , are rising inexorably. The cost of such imports has risen to nearly $50 billion in the first 9 months of the financial year, coming close to the cost of our oil imports. The figures, especially the increase in sales of consumer durables Link: http://www.livemint.com/Industry/J7bedNXvkbJkv21RYM6gRI/Industrial-production-up-75-in-January.html , indicate that the economy is beginning to grow again, wrote AR Mishra. Maybe not, wrote SP Mampatta. The asset turnover ratio, which is the ratio of net sales for every Rs 100 worth of fixed assets,has dropped to 1.95 from 2.94 between 2006 to 2016 Link: http://www.livemint.com/Politics/WT4BUkE9W32HbsXMaofTRO/Will-private-sector-investment-in-India-see-sustained-recov.html . Which means that Rs 100 worth of fixed assets now generate net sales worth Rs 195, compared to Rs 294 in the previous decade. Something is growing, but we don't know what it is. So, we hope.

If they are happy they won't mind paying. Link: https://indiadying.blogspot.com/2018/03/if-they-are-happy-they-wont-mind-paying.html

In terms of earningsIndia ranks 7th in the world in tourism Link: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/industry/services/travel/indias-is-the-worlds-7th-largest-tourism-economy-in-terms-of-gdp-says-wttc/articleshow/58011112.cms , making Rs 14.1 trillion, or $208.9 billion in 2016. Tourism constitutes 9.6% of GDP and creates 40.3 million jobs, which is 9.3% of total jobs in India. However, in terms of numbers India comes 40th in the world, with only 9 million tourists, which is one-tenth of what France receives. Prof N Kaushal analyses why India receives so few tourists Link: https://blogs.economictimes.indiatimes.com/et-commentary/how-tourism-can-create-jobs-exports-and-gdp-growth-and-better-brand-india/ . Turkey received 3 times as many international tourists as India in 2016, despite increasingly despotic rule Link: https://edition.cnn.com/2017/01/04/europe/why-turkey-is-terror-target/index.html by Recep Tayyip Erdogan, repeated terrorist attacks Link: http://time.com/4626174/turkey-istanbul-izmir-kurdish-isis-erdogan/ and the war next door in Syria. "Taj Mahal had half-a-million tourists, the Statue of Liberty in NY received four times as many, and the Great Wall of China received six times as many." The government has been improving infrastructure and access to tourist sites for foreigners. E-visas are available to citizens of a large number Link: https://indianvisaonline.gov.in/evisa/tvoa.html of countries. The new expressway from Delhi to Agra is wide and has much less traffic, for a smooth drive to the Taj Mahal. The problem is that the official site for the Taj Mahal Link: http://www.tajmahal.gov.in/ does not warn Indians that they must carry proof of identity to prove they are Indian. Which creates arguments and anger at the entry point when people are stopped from entering. Obviously, they cannot go back to their villages to get their identity proofs. Nor does the site tell you that the ticket for foreigners, which costs Rs 1000, includes entry to Agra Fort as well. A visit to the Taj Mahal is not complete without a visit to the Fort because Shah Jahan, the man who built the Taj, was imprisoned there for the last 8 years of his life Link: https://www.importantindia.com/5279/last-days-of-shah-jahan/ and would spend his time gazing at the monument in memory of his wife. The Red Fort in Delhi Link: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_Fort is undergoing reconstruction so that all the palaces inside are blocked to visitors. There is no warning and people are being charged full amounts for tickets. Delhi zoo is beautiful inside. Extremely clean with beautiful lawns and electric vehicles to take people around. But, you have to pay Rs 70 to take a camera inside and nothing for mobile phones, all of which have cameras. Sadly, animals do not look happy Link: https://www.hindustantimes.com/delhi-news/delhi-zoo-records-highest-mortality-in-india-171-animals-dead-within-a-year/story-xYWeGUTgAIZ97nLQFczX3N.html . There is one tiger, one jaguar, one gharial and just one wolf. Wolves are pack animals so it must be especially lonely for it. Then there are the people. Foreigners, especially women with blond hair, are requested for photos by locals. Although security is very impressive at the entrance there is no one inside to stop this harassment. The infrastructure has definitely improved. Emphasis should now be on making tourists feel happy so that they come back. Tourists mean money.

Dictators have an advantage over democracies. Link: https://indiadying.blogspot.com/2018/03/dictators-have-advantage-over.html

Italians have voted for anti-establishment parties, with the Five Star Movement emerging as the largest party with about 32.6% Link: http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-43272700 of the vote. The right wing coalition of former Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi's Forza Italia and the anti-immigrant Northern League is set to get 37%, with 99% of votes counted. The left wing coalition of the present Prime Minister Matteo Renzi,who used extreme violence to try and stop a referendum Link: http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-41677911 for independence in Catalonia last year, received only 22.8% of votes. Renzi has resigned. The Five StarMovement was set up by a comedian, Beppe Grillo Link: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Five_Star_Movement who is a Eurosceptic and alter-globalist. The result is a reflection of anger of ordinary Italians against the main parties and against Europe Link: https://www.theatlantic.com/international/archive/2018/03/italy-election-european-union/554900/ for the state of the economy. Just like an angry "basket of deplorables" Link: https://www.vox.com/2016/9/14/12896540/hillary-basket-of-deplorables was instrumental in Donald Trump's upset over Hillary Clinton, so angry Italians have shown the door to mainstream parties. In Germany, AngelaMerkel has succeeded in forming a coalition 5 months Link: http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-43276732 after general elections because voters showed their anger by giving 12.6% of votes to the anti-immigrant AfD party Link: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German_federal_election,_2017 , which will have 94 seats in the Bundestag. Merkel's open door policy towards migrants has created areas where half the population is foreign Link: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-5461211/SUE-REID-Angela-Merkels-real-legacy.html , dependent on social security, and where police are afraid to go. While people democratic countries can vent their anger they are helpless in autocracies. Xi Jinping is set tobe crowned the undisputed emperor of China Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/a71fRRF3kkpBqUQqbBJVZN/Xi-Jinping-is-unmaking-Deng-Xiaopings-China.html by the Communist Party's annual National People's Congress. All other nations are trying to work out the medium Link: https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/congress/xi-term-limits-controversy-looms-at-china-political-meeting/2018/03/04/85d71360-200c-11e8-946c-9420060cb7bd_story.html?utm_term=.9260a43a54b8 to long term implications of this event. Since Mao Zedong no one has accumulated so much power. Mao's Great Leap Forward resulted in the death of 20-30 million people from starvation Link: http://www.nytimes.com/2010/12/16/opinion/16iht-eddikotter16.html and forced some people to resort to cannibalism. The more power Xi has the more desirable his head becomes. Censors have banned thechildren's character Winnie the Pooh Link: http://www.bbc.com/news/blogs-china-blog-40627855 , because people compare Xi to it, and the letter 'N' because scientists write 'N>2' Link: https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/28/world/asia/china-censorship-xi-jinping.html , referring to the scrapping of the two-term limit. Naturally,Animal Farm has also been banned Link: http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/972994/chinese-president-xi-jinping-bans-words-animal-farm-disagree-i-oppose-among-others . Meanwhile, Turkey is gradually becoming like Pakistan Link: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/international/world-news/view-slowly-but-surely-turkey-is-becoming-the-next-pakistan-just-look-at-these-signs/articleshow/63157053.cms , with President Recep Tayyip Erdogan arresting opponents by the thousands and bombing Kurds in Syria. Just as it had shot down a Russian plane over Syrian territory Link: http://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-34912581 on 2015, so Turkey bombed 36 Syrian troops to death Link: http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/syria-turkey-airstrikes-afrin-latest-updates-forces-killed-bombing-operation-olive-branch-a8238201.html 3 days back. Turkey is part of NATO and is using US supplied planes for its attacks. Weak governments in the West and ruthless dictators, not a good combination.
