Prominent, but not powerful. Link: https://indiadying.blogspot.com/2018/03/prominent-but-not-powerful.html

India must stay neutral if an economic war breaks Link: https://blogs.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/Swaminomics/why-india-should-lie-low-if-a-us-china-trade-war-erupts/ out between the US and China, wrote SA Aiyer. This is after Donald Trumpannounced tariffs of 25% on steel and 10% on aluminium Link: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trade-trump/trump-to-impose-steep-tariffs-on-steel-aluminum-stokes-trade-war-fears-idUSKCN1GD4ZW imports into the US. China was critical of the US decision Link: https://www.thehindubusinessline.com/news/world/china-slams-trumps-move-to-impose-tariffs/article22909298.ece but has not retaliated so far. Maybe because metals account for only 5.1% of US imports from China, while electronics and machinery made up 48% Link: https://www.bloombergquint.com/china/2018/03/02/how-trump-could-really-hurt-china-on-trade-target-electronics . Furniture and toys account for 16.5% of imports from China, while textiles and clothes make up 8.6%. The European Union's response was more muscular, threatening tariffs on US exports to Europe. To thatTrump threatened higher tariffs on European cars Link: https://www.ndtv.com/world-news/us-president-donald-trump-escalates-trade-war-threatens-european-carmakers-with-stiff-tariffs-1819329 . Europe imposes a tax of 10% on US cars while the US taxes European cars at only 2.5%. The fear is that tit-for-tat tariffs may lead to a trade war. Trump tweeted that "trade wars are good, and easy to win". India enjoys a trade surplus of $30 billion with the US Link: https://ustr.gov/countries-regions/south-central-asia/india . Our trade with Europe is roughly balanced, with Europe having a slight edge in goods Link: http://ec.europa.eu/trade/policy/countries-and-regions/countries/india/ while India has an equal edge in services. India had a trade deficit with China of $52 billion Link: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/economy/foreign-trade/indian-exports-to-china-goes-up-by-over-53-per-cent-in-october/articleshow/62104921.cms . It makes no sense for India to take sides in this fight between heavyweights. "If, however, an anti-US coalition gathers force, especially in multilateral forums like the WTO, India could unobtrusively join that crowd, making sure it does not stand out," wrote Aiyar. Is it possible to take a contrary stance and remain unobserved? India is too big for that. Last year India voted against the US decision torecognize Jerusalem as the capital of Israel Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/fnEMgsIMs1FGsz89OplH7M/UN-Jerusalem-vote-Why-India-went-against-the-US.html at the UN General Assembly. Although we were one of 128 countries who voted against the US, Israel protested to our government Link: http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/239949 . The problem is that although we are big enough to be unobtrusive we are not big enough to throw our weight around, like China does Link: https://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/a-strategy-through-investments-why-china-s-silk-road-plan-has-spelt-unease-for-india-us-russia/story-oRsPwwV6J18gFGdqM4XdSM.html . India has already raised customs duty across the board and increased cess Link: http://www.livemint.com/Industry/TRi7VbYHggRPieYjWSVYBJ/Customs-duty-raised-in-Budget-2018-to-promote-Make-in-India.html to 10% from 3%, in next year's budget. Then we stopped providing data to foreign exchanges Link: http://www.livemint.com/Money/5mVk67jcr1qkiOEVMhU4AP/Indian-bourses-to-stop-providing-data-feeds-to-overseas-exch.html to stop derivatives trading outside our borders. Why we need to protect our businesses and markets from foreign competition when our economy is booming at 7.2% Link: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/economy/indicators/indias-gdp-growth-rises-to-7-2-in-december-quarter/articleshow/63111337.cms is a mystery. The global investment index provider, MSCI immediatelycondemned our decision and warned of reduced weightage Link: http://www.livemint.com/Money/oEBQmA5Dd0TSkuXKRJDPWK/MSCI-asks-India-stock-exchanges-to-reconsider-anticompetiti.html for our markets, while looking to increase weightage ofChina whose markets are controlled by the government Link: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/markets/stocks/news/dear-msci-india-is-open-and-welcomes-foreign-investors/articleshow/62978325.cms , inviting scathing criticism by N Shah. Our exports have been declining while imports have increased Link: http://www.livemint.com/Money/e0OpGyjs5aAbhvdGVmf5MO/Stagnant-exports-burgeoning-imports.html , leading to widening trade deficit. We are therefore in the unique position of being weak, but unable to hide. We should never take sides.

Saturday, March 03, 2018

What have they been promised, reward or threat? Link: https://indiadying.blogspot.com/2018/03/is-it-reward-or-threat.html

The architect of the Indian biometric identification card Aadhaar, N Nilekani Link: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nandan_Nilekani wrote that it is a "universal digital infrastructure, not just a scheme Link: https://www.hindustantimes.com/opinion/why-aadhaar-infrastructure-should-be-opened-up-for-private-innovation/story-fPnV8XQAVuKypg9BqPtQ0O.html ". Why is he making this distinction? Because he thinks that the government should make money from it by allowing private players to use it. Just because the government builds highways does not mean that "only State-owned vehicles will drive on it". When the state cannot deliver services the private sector steps in but their services are available only to the elite. Allowing private players to use Aadhaar will increase "universal oversight". "The Aadhaar system does not collect the specific purpose of your authentication, or the location of your transaction so there is no way the system can construct where you were Link: https://blogs.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/toi-edit-page/what-aadhaar-collects-fears-of-a-surveillance-state-are-overblown-but-a-robust-privacy-bill-is-needed/ and what you were doing," wrote S Nadhamuni, also associated with setting up this system. Therefore, Aadhaar can never be used to spy on us, these two try to convince us. But, "Aadhaar is not so dumb," wrote Prof I Rajaraman. "To use Nilekani's phrasing, it does indeed offer a deep profile on a person Link: http://www.livemint.com/Opinion/YIQp7wzt57jtmK0h1dlUuK/Fiscal-stress-and-revenue-generation-from-Aadhaar.html because it has now been linked to the permanent account number (PAN) and through that to the entire direct tax record of the person, to mobile numbers and therefore to the entire telephone records of the person, to all bank accounts, and all financial instruments, debit and credit cards." Online service providers have records of our "likes, browsing patterns and desires", wrote Nilekani. According to some surveys over 75% of people lie on social media Link: https://nakedsecurity.sophos.com/2016/04/07/over-75-of-people-lie-on-social-media/ . Nothing Google or Facebook can do about it. Fingerprints and iris scans cannot lie and we will be arrested if we lied to the government. "Apps from Google, Facebook, Apple and thousands of other companies are also able to track smartphone user location using GPS sensors," wrote Nadhamuni. We can switch off smartphones or use a Nokia 3310 Link: https://www.nokia.com/en_int/phones/nokia-3310 , but the government has made Aadhaar mandatory for everything from buying train tickets to using a credit card in a restaurant. "I would much rather trust the State's institutions" wrote Nilekani. He is one of the 85% of Indians who trust the government Link: https://factly.in/fact-check-pew-research-said-85-indians-trust-government/ . But that is not the point. Zuckerberg or Sergey Brin, or indeed Donald Trump can do nothing to us but the government can and does. The Supreme Court described the CBI as a "caged parrot" Link: https://in.reuters.com/article/cbi-supreme-court-parrot-coal/a-caged-parrot-supreme-court-describes-cbi-idINDEE94901W20130510 which harasses opponents while protecting the government. Anyone traveling to the US Link: https://www.path2usa.com/fingerprinting-and-biometrics-for-us-visa or to Europe Link: https://in.ambafrance.org/Schengen-States-implement-biometric-visas-in-India need to provide fingerprints and photograph, but only a tiny minority travel abroad. If Amazon or HSBC are allowed to use the Aadhaar infrastructure biometric details of every Indian will be available to the US and European governments. So why are Nilekani and Nadhamuni betraying fellow citizens by defending this pernicious system? What have they been promised?

Friday, March 02, 2018

Chances of getting trumped. Link: https://indiadying.blogspot.com/2018/03/chances-of-getting-trumped.html

The Indian economy grew by 7.2% in the last quarter Link: http://www.livemint.com/Politics/QluAX4FUs726bSLtm7pueN/Indias-GDP-growth-risesfalls-to-72-in-December-quarter.html ending on 31 December, wrote R Nair. Consumer demand fell to 5.6% of GDP but investment demand went up to 12%. The 3 sectors which lagged were mining Link: http://www.thehindu.com/opinion/editorial/buoyant-again-on-indias-gdp-growth/article22897516.ece , utilities, comprising of electricity, gas and water, and trade, which includes hotels, transport and communication services. Although Gross Value Added for the full year is expect to increase, agriculture and manufacturing are expected to weaken. Most of the growth was due to government spending which rose to 6.1%. "In fact, the biggest engine of growth continues to be government spending, which is supposed to grow by 11 per cent in real terms this year," wrote M Sharma. "Put that together with India's troubling fiscal deficit -- which is pushing seven per cent of GDP Link: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/economy/indicators/indias-bouncing-back-but-still-not-high-enough/articleshow/63120140.cms when both the federal and state governments are included, one of the worst figures in the G-20 -- and this revival starts to look a bit unsustainable." The central government's fiscal deficit reached 113.7% of GDP Link: https://www.bloombergquint.com/business/2018/02/28/indias-april-january-fiscal-deficit-reaches-114-of-revised-full-year-target till the end of January. That may not be the final figure because advance tax collections from companies tend to jump in March. However, the government cannot increase spending to protect against a fall in growth, without making the deficit significantly worse. This is where Donald Trump comes in. Prime Minister Modi criticised Trump for protectionism Link: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-davos-meeting-modi/indian-pm-modi-defends-globalization-at-davos-summit-idUSKBN1FC1AL at the World Economic Forum in Davos in January. "The result of this is that we are seeing new types of tariffs and non-tariff-based barriers being imposed," he said. Indeed. Following that speech the Finance Minister massively hiked customs duty Link: https://www.bloombergquint.com/union-budget-2018/2018/02/01/union-budget-2018-the-list-of-items-with-changes-in-custom-duty on almost all imported goods, in next year's budget. Not just that, sly taxes, camouflaged as Education Cess and Social Welfare Surcharge Link: http://www.livemint.com/Industry/TRi7VbYHggRPieYjWSVYBJ/Customs-duty-raised-in-Budget-2018-to-promote-Make-in-India.html , went up from 3% to 10%. The Prime Minister would surely have known about this while he was serving bromide at Davos. Trump is complaining that India taxes Harley-Davidson motorcycles at 50% Link: https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/economy/foreign-trade/harley-davidson-issue-trump-says-getting-nothing-after-india-reduces-tariffs-on-motorcycles/articleshow/63090465.cms while the US levies no taxes on exports of motorcycles from India. India exports few motorbikes to the US Link: https://www.cartoq.com/2018-mercedes-c-class-facelift/ but that is not the worry. Trump has just announced a 25% tariff on imports of steel Link: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trade-trump/trump-to-impose-steep-tariffs-on-steel-aluminum-stokes-trade-war-fears-idUSKCN1GD4ZW and 10% on aluminium. Other countries have threatened retaliation but Trump tweeted, "When a country (USA) is losing billions of dollars on trade with virtually every other country it does business with, trade wars are good, and easy to win Link: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trade/trade-wars-are-good-trump-says-defying-global-concern-over-tariffs-idUSKCN1GE1PM ." India has a positive trade balance of $30 billion with the US Link: https://ustr.gov/countries-regions/south-central-asia/india and Trump could levy taxes on anything he wants. The Federal Reserve is expected to raise the Federal Funds Rate more aggressively Link: https://www.cnbc.com/2018/01/30/fed-will-be-forced-to-raise-rates-more-rapidly-than-expected-cnbc-fed-survey.html this year which could hit the rupee and Indian share prices. General elections by May of next year. Trump could trump Modi.
